## 3.1 FeatureCollections

Vector data (Points, Lines, Polygons) are handled as `ee.FeatureCollection`.

### Using Public Datasets
Access administrative boundaries like FAO GAUL or TIGER (US).

```javascript
// Load Global Administrative Unit Layers (GAUL)
var india = ee.FeatureCollection('FAO/GAUL/2015/level0')
  .filter(ee.Filter.eq('ADM0_NAME', 'India'));

Map.addLayer(india, {color: 'black'}, 'India Boundary');
```

## 3.2 Uploading Your Own Data

1. Go to the **Assets** tab.
2. Click **New** > **Table Upload (Shapefile)**.
3. Select your `.shp`, `.shx`, `.dbf`, and `.prj` files.
4. Once uploaded, import it into your script using `var myData = ee.FeatureCollection('users/username/assetName');`.

## 3.3 Charting: Time Series Analysis

Charts allow us to visualize temporal trends. Let's plot an NDVI time series for a region.

```javascript
// Load MODIS Vegetation Indices (16-day global)
var modis = ee.ImageCollection('MODIS/006/MOD13Q1')
  .filterDate('2020-01-01', '2023-12-31')
  .select('NDVI');

// Define region (e.g., a protected forest)
var forest = ee.Geometry.Point([84.0, 21.0]).buffer(1000);

// Create Time Series Chart
var chart = ui.Chart.image.series({
  imageCollection: modis,
  region: forest,
  reducer: ee.Reducer.mean(),
  scale: 250
}).setOptions({
  title: 'NDVI Time Series (2020-2023)',
  hAxis: {title: 'Date'},
  vAxis: {title: 'NDVI (x10000)'},
  lineWidth: 1,
  pointSize: 3
});

print(chart);
```
